definition: since ancient times/it has ever been the case that/see also 自古以來|自古以来[zi4 gu3 yi3 lai2]
to come/to arrive/to come round/ever since/next

sentences.english: I became referee for Kulai under 16 basketball championship final game.
sentences.chinese: 我今晚在古來的16歲以下籃球決賽中擔任裁判。

sentences.english: They had to hide until the men of Quraish gave up looking for them.
sentences.chinese: 他們必須隱蔽起來直到古來氏人不再找他們。

sentences.english: Since ancient times, fall is the season to think, she makes a more mature and competent manner.
sentences.chinese: 秋天古來都是多思的季節，她使人更加地成熟與幹練。

sentences.english: Throughout the ages, all people of accomplishment have taken their lives seriously.
sentences.chinese: 古來一切有成就的人，都很嚴肅地對待自己的生命。

sentences.english: The people of ancient China recognized the supreme lord, but did not know about the Buddha.
sentences.chinese: 古來中國的人，不知道有佛，就只知道有上帝。

sentences.english: On the Chinese and Foreign esthetics history, many people have researched into inspiration.
sentences.chinese: 在中外美學史上，對靈感的研究古來有之。

sentences.english: This is one of the age old myths that are still prevalent.
sentences.chinese: 這是仍然普遍存在的古來的謬論之一。

sentences.english: Throughout the ages, all people of aplishment have taken their lives seriously.
sentences.chinese: 古來一切有結果績的人，都很嚴肅地看待本身的生命。

definition: to visit places famous for their scenery
writing up of official or judicial documents/pettifoggery
orpiment/arsenic trisulfide As2S3/make changes in writing/malign/criticize without grounds
old anecdote/stories passed on from former times
"immortal of poetry", epithet of Li Bai 李白[Li3 Bai2]
